title: The Structure of LAGOSNE
text: Lake Multi-Scaled Geospatial Temporal Database (LAGOSNE) combination three data modules (LAGOSlocus, LAGOSlimno, LAGOSgeo) designed use researchers managers facilitate development basic understanding lake water quality broad scales using water quality data thousands lakes collected last several decades. database includes information lakes lake-rich region 17 states United States, including Minnesota, Iowa, Wisconsin, Illinois, Missouri, Michigan, Indiana, Ohio, Pennsylvania, New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, New Hampshire, Rhode Island, Massachusetts, Vermont, Maine. LAGOSNE contains complete census lakes greater 4 hectares region supporting ecological context information. Additionally, subset lakes, LAGOSNE contains water quality data. LAGOSNE package built future data users easily retrieve manipulate data, well easily access metadata. LAGOSNE product many thousands human hours course data collection integration. nitty gritty details efforts (highly recommend!) can found two locations. details describing LAGOSNE built, including sources metric derivations, can found (Soranno et al. 2015). details data , along data, can found Soranno et al.Â 2017.

title: The Structure of LAGOSNE
text: includes following tables: epi_nutr lakes_limno lagos_source_program LAGOSlimno integration preexisting water quality data disparate sources, including state, federal, tribal, university organizations. Water chemistry (various species nitrogen, phosphorus, carbon) transparency (Secchi disk measurement) main features epi_nutr table, also include metadata measurements. ?epi_nutr gives names variables metadata (including units). observation LAGOSlimno discrete sampling event, one water quality parameters measured. Sampling events tied lakes unique LAGOSNE National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) identifier, lakes can single multiple obervations parameter. 14,657 unique lakes epi_nutr distributed across 17-state region.

title: The Structure of LAGOSNE
text: includes tables whose names contain following text strings: chag conn lulc buffer lakes.geo LAGOSgeo integration information describing air, water, land (hereafter, ecological context) surrounding lakes greater equal 4 hectares surface area LAGOSNE 17-state region. LAGOSgeo contains three themes data describe ecological context lake: CHAG (climate, hydrology, atmospheric deposition, surficial geology), CONN (stream, wetland, lake surficial hydrologic connectivity), LULC (land use/land cover). metrics temporal coverage (e.g., atmospheric deposition) whereas others represent average conditions period time (e.g., 30-year climate normals). source data metric derivation theme LAGOSgeo calculated one nine spatial classifications (see ?classifications). table names classification-theme combination formatted [classification].[theme] (e.g., state.chag, hu4.conn, iws.lulc). theme table within LAGOSgeo connected help file can viewed calling either theme table name (e.g., ?state.chag ?chag).

what: Boxplot of average chlorophyll by state
title: Working with LAGOSNE
text: first analysis involves constructing boxplot average lake chlorophyll state. begin, join nutrient water quality table (epi.nutr) location information lake locus table. Next, join output state table obtain state abbreviations correspond lake. Finally, filter dataset exclude lakes fall within state. Now, state column character type alphabetical order default. need cast column factor reorder levels East West preparation plotting. Finally, construct boxplot ggplot:
code: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  lg <- left_join(dt$epi_nutr, dt$locus) lg <- left_join(lg, dt$state) lg <- group_by(lg, state) lg <- filter(lg, !is.na(state)) state_easting <- summarize(lg,   mean_easting = mean(nhd_long, na.rm = TRUE)) state_easting <- arrange(state_easting, mean_easting)  lg$state <- factor(lg$state, levels = state_easting$state) ggplot(lg) +   geom_boxplot(aes(x = state, y = chla), outlier.shape = NA) +   ylim(c(0, 80)) + ylab("Chlorophyll a (ug/L)")

what: Map of average chlorophyll in Pennsylvania
title: Working with LAGOSNE
text: second analysis involves constructing map average lake chlorophyll concentration Pennsylvania lakes. begin, use maps sf package obtain geographic outline state. Next, filter output previous analysis include PA lakes calculate mean chlorophyll lake: Finally, turn data.frame sf geospatial object using st_as_sf constructing map ggplot geom_sf.
code: library(maps) library(sf)  states <- st_as_sf(map("state", plot = FALSE, fill = TRUE)) pa     <- filter(states, ID == "pennsylvania") pa_chl <- filter(lg, state == "PA") pa_chl <- group_by(pa_chl, lagoslakeid) pa_chl <- summarize(pa_chl,   mean_chl  = mean(chla, na.rm = TRUE),   mean_long = mean(nhd_long, na.rm = TRUE),   mean_lat  = mean(nhd_lat, na.rm = TRUE)) pa_chl <- filter(pa_chl, !is.na(mean_chl)) pa_chl <- st_as_sf(pa_chl, coords = c("mean_long", "mean_lat"), crs = 4326)  ggplot() +   geom_sf(data = pa) +   geom_sf(data = pa_chl, aes(color = log(mean_chl))) +   theme_bw() + scale_color_gradient(low = "white", high = "darkgreen") +   labs(color = "log(Chlorophyll a (ug/L))")

what: Interface to the Lake Multi-Scaled Geospatial and Temporal Database
title: Interface to the Lake Multi-Scaled Geospatial and Temporal Database
text: LAGOSNE package provides R interface download LAGOS-NE data, store data locally, perform variety filtering subsetting operations. LAGOS-NE contains data 51,101 lakes reservoirs larger 4 ha 17 lake-rich US states. database includes 3 data modules : lake location physical characteristics lakes; ecological context (.e., land use, geologic, climatic, hydrologic setting lakes) lakes; situ measurements lake water quality subset lakes past 3 decades approximately 2,600-12,000 lakes depending variable (see Soranno et al.Â 2017 ).

title: Interface to the Lake Multi-Scaled Geospatial and Temporal Database
text: lagosne_get function downloads LAGOSNE files corresponding specified version EDI data repository. Files stored temporary directory âcompiledâ R data format location specified dest_folder argument. Recommended setting lagos_path(). Data needs downloaded one time per version per machine. LAGOSNE module unique version number. However, limno module dynamically updated. Therefore LAGOSNE R package uses limno module version number check-specific datasets. latest version LAGOSNE dataset 1.087.3.

what: LAGOSNE Spatial Classifications Metadata â classifications
title: LAGOSNE Spatial Classifications Metadata â classifications
text: Data frames containing metadata spatial classification  ecological context data derived LAGOSNE. spatial classifications  include 100m buffers (buffer100m),  500m buffers (buffer500m), interlake watersheds (iws),  hydrologic units (hu12, hu8, hu4), ecological drainage units (edu),  counties (county), states (state). abbreviation name  data frame, subset following variables.  information derivation spatial classification, see Details  Additional file 7  Soranno et al. 2015.

title: LAGOSNE Spatial Classifications Metadata â classifications
text: Data frames subset following variables. Number observations equal number zones spatial classification (see Details ). *_nhdid: permanent lake-specific identifier National     Hydrography Dataset (* = buffer100m, buffer500m, iws) *_name: text name zone (* = iws, hu12, hu8, hu4,     county, state) hu*: unique zone identifier (* = 12, 8, 4) *_ha: area spatial classification hectares     (* = buffer100m, buffer500m, hu12, hu8, hu4, edu,     county) *_areaha: area spatial classification hectares (* = iws, ) *_perimkm: perimeter spatial classification kilometers     (* = iws, ) *_lat: latitude centroid polygon decimal degrees (NAD83)     (* = iws, hu12, hu8, hu4, edu, county, state) *_long: longitude centroid polygon decimal degrees     (NAD83) (* = iws, hu12, hu8, hu4, edu, county, state) *_lakeareaha: lake area (ha) focal lake associated polygon     (* = iws, ) *_country: whether polygon lies within US ("US")     US Canada (US_CA) (* = hu12, edu) *_pct_in_usa: percent polygon within US boundary (* = iws,     hu12, edu) *_ha_in_usa: area (ha) polygon within US boundary (* = iws,     hu12, edu) *_pct_in_nwi: percent polygon within USFWS National Wetland     Inventory (NWI) boundary (* = hu12, hu8, hu4, edu, county, state) *_ha_in_nwi: area (ha) polygon within USFWS National     Wetland Inventory (NWI) boundary (* = hu12, hu8, hu4, edu, county,     state) *_zoneid: unique identifier IWS LAGOSNE, numbered 1:n     classification prefix (e.g., HU12_1) (* = iws, hu12, hu8, hu4, edu,     county, state) lagoslakeid: LAGOSNE unique identifier focal lake hu4_states: states intersect hu4 zone polygon state: 2-letter state abbreviation county_state: state county located

title: LAGOSNE Spatial Classifications Metadata â classifications
text: nine LAGOSNE spatial classifications used summarize ecological context lake. Ecological context themes include land use/land cover (LULC), connectivity (CONN), climate, hydrology, atmospheric deposition, groundwater (CHAG). themes derived classifications due data availability. Briefly: iws: dataframe 51065 observations 12 variables. area     land drains directly lake,     upstream-connected, permanent streams lake exclusive     upstream lake watersheds lakes greater  10 ha     connected via permanent streams.  details watersheds     delineated, see additional file 8 Soranno et al. (2015). Themes     derived iws classification include LULC CONN. buffer100m: dataframe 51065 3 variables.     Buffers 100 m equidistant buffer land 100 m     lake shoreline, calculated using ArcGIS Buffer tool. Themes     derived 100m buffer classification include LULC. buffer500m: dataframe 51065 3 variables.     Buffers 500 m equidistant buffer land 500 m     lake shoreline, calculated using ArcGIS Buffer tool. Themes     derived 500m buffer classification include LULC CONN. hu12: dataframe 20257 observations 11 variables.     Watershed Boundary Dataset defines boundaries based surface water     drainage creates nested Hydrologic Units (sometimes abbreviated     referred HUCs, hydrologic unit codes)     georeferenced USGS 1:24,000 topographic base map. HUC12s     sixth level classificiation. HUC12s defined along natural     hydrologic breaks based land surface surface-water flow     single flow outlet except frontal, lake, braided-stream,     closed-basin hydrologic units. Themes derived HUC12     classification include LULC, CONN CHAG. hu8: data frame 511 observations 9 variables. HUC8s     fourth level classificiation. Sometimes called 'watersheds',     HUC8 geographic area representing part surface     drainage basin, combination drainage basins, distinct     hydrologic feature. Themes derived HUC8 classification include     LULC, CONN, CHAG. hu4: data frame 65 observations 9 variables. HUC4s     second level classification, called 'subregion'. subregion     includes area drained river system, reach river     tributaries reach, closed basin(s), group streams     forming coastal drainage area. Themes derived HUC4     classification include LULC, CONN, CHAG. edu: data frame 91 observations 10 variables.     Ecological drainage units (EDUs) follow WBD boundaries,     roughly similar size HUC6s. EDUs delineated grouping     HUC8 watersheds based common zoogeographic history,     physiographic climatic characteristics. Themes derived EDU     classification include LULC, CONN, CHAG. county: data frame 955 observations 8 variables.     Counties (political boundary) within 17-state region LAGOSNE.     Themes derived county classification include LULC, CONN,     CHAG. state: dataframe 17 observations 7 variables. Themes     derived state classification include LULC, CONN, CHAG.

title: Connectivity Datasets â conn
text: Data frames subset following variables. Number observations equal number zones spatial classification (see ?classifications). Wildcard options include subset LAGOSNE spatial classifications (* = buffer500m, iws, hu12, hu8, hu4, edu, county, state) additional wildcards described . Identifiers Zone Metadata *_zoneid: unique zone identifier *_nwiexclusions: zones completely covered          National Wetlands Inventory Lake Connectivity Metrics. Lake abundance metrics derived      lakes, isolated lakes ("isolated" - inflow outflow streams),      headwater lakes ("headwater" - inflowing streams), stream      drainage lakes ("drstream" - lakes inflowing stream(s),      without outflows, upstream lakes greater 10 ha), lake      drainage lakes ("drlakeStream" lakes inflowing stream(s)      least one upstream lake greater 10 ha). text: Select filter LAGOSNE data keyword helpers.

title: Select and filter LAGOSNE data â lagosne_select
code: lagosne_select(   table = NULL,   vars = NULL,   categories = NULL,   dt = lagosne_load(lagosne_version()) )

title: Select and filter LAGOSNE data â lagosne_select
text: table character name dt table vars character vector specific column names select table categories type variables kept. Note scale-category options available. Variable categories include: "waterquality" - includes -situ chemistry, chlorophyll, water clarity measurements epi_nutr table. "deposition" - atmospheric deposition variables .chag tables "hydrology" - baseflow, groundwater, runoff, overland flow variables .chag tables "climate" - 30-year normal precipitation temperature variables .chag tables "geology" - surficial geology variables .chag tables "topography" - Terrain Roughness Index slope variables .lulc tables "lulc1992" - 1992 land use/land cover variables .lulc tables "lulc2001" - 2001 land use/land cover variables .lulc tables "lulc2006" - 2006 land use/land cover variables .lulc tables "lulc2011" - 2011 land use/land cover variables .lulc tables "lakes" - lake connectivity metrics .conn tables "wetlands" - wetland connectivity metrics .conn tables "streams" - stream/river connectivity metrics .conn tables dt data.frame local copy LAGOSNE data.  Can loaded lagosne_load use version specified lagosne_version.

title: Select and filter LAGOSNE data â lagosne_select
code: if (FALSE) { dt <- lagosne_load("1.087.3")  # specific variables head(lagosne_select(table = "epi_nutr", vars = c("tp", "tn"))) head(lagosne_select(table = "iws.lulc", vars = c("iws_nlcd2011_pct_95")))  # categories head(lagosne_select(table = "epi_nutr", categories = "waterquality")) head(lagosne_select(table = "county.chag", categories = "hydrology")) head(lagosne_select(table = "hu4.chag", categories = "deposition"))  # mix of specific variables and categories head(lagosne_select(table = "epi_nutr", vars = "lagoslakeid", categories = c("waterquality")))  }

code: if (FALSE) { lake_info(lagoslakeid = 4314) lake_info(lagoslakeid = 7441) lake_info(lagoslakeid = 244) lake_info(lagoslakeid = 4686) lake_info(lagoslakeid = 8016) lake_info(lagoslakeid = c(21864, 2317)) lake_info(lagoslakeid = c(1441)) lake_info(lagoslakeid = c(125428, 1441)) lake_info(lagoslakeid = c(4686, 8016))  # fuzzy matching to lake name lake_info(name = "Duck Lake", state = "Michigan") # exact matching to lake name lake_info(name = "Duck Lake", state = "Michigan",           max.distance = list(all = 0))  lake_info(name = "Sunapee Lake", state = "New Hampshire") lake_info(name = c("Sunapee Lake", "Oneida Lake"),               state = c("New Hampshire", "New York")) }

title: Land Use Land Cover (LULC) Data Frames â lulc
text: Data frames subset following variables. Number observations equal number zones spatial scale (see Details ). Wildcard options include 9 LAGOSNE spatial scales (* = buffer100m, buffer500m, iws, hu12, hu8, hu4, edu, county, state), year measurement (** = 1992, 2001, 2006, 2011), unit measurement hectares percent zone area (*** = ha, pct unless noted otherwise). variable available scale, year, unit unless otherwise noted. *_nhdid (* = buffer100m, buffer500m, iws) *_canopy2001_***: per pixel tree canopy percent measured 2001.     Summary statistics include minimum, maximum, mean standard deviation     (*** = min, max, mean, std). *_damdensity_***: dams zone. Summary statistics include point    count, points per hectare, points per square kilometer    (*** = pointcount, pointsperha, pointspersqkm) *_nlcd**_***_0: data *_nlcd**_***_11: Open water *_nlcd1992_***_21: Residential, low intensity *_nlcd**_***_21: Developed, open space. Note, variable    measured 1992 (** = 2001, 2006, 2011) *_nlcd1992_***_22: Residential, high intensity *_nlcd**_***_22: Developed, low intensity. Note, variable    measured 1992 (** = 2001, 2006, 2011) *_nlcd1992_***_23: Commercial/industrial/transportation *_nlcd**_***_23: Developed, medium intensity. Note, variable    measured 1992 (** = 2001, 2006, 2011) *_nlcd**_***_24: Developed, high Intensity. Note, variable    measured 1992 (** = 2001, 2006, 2011) *_nlcd**_***_31: Bare rock/sand/clay *_nlcd1992_***_32: Quarries/strip mines/gravel pits measured    1992 *_nlcd1992_***_33: Transitional (barren) measured 1992 *_nlcd**_***_41: Deciduous forest *_nlcd**_***_42: Evergreen forest *_nlcd**_***_43: Mixed forest *_nlcd1992_***_51: Shrubland measured 1992. *_nlcd1992_***_52: Scrub/shrub. Note, variable measured    1992    (** = 2001, 2006, 2011) *_nlcd1992_***_61: Orchards/vineyards/measured 1992. *_nlcd**_***_71: Grasslands/herbaceous *_nlcd**_***_81: Pasture/hay *_nlcd**_***_82: Row crops *_nlcd1992_***_83: Small grains measured 1992. *_nlcd1992_***_85: Urban/recreational grasses measured 1992. *_nlcd**_***_90: Woody wetlands. Note, variable calculated     1992    (** = 2001, 2006, 2011). Equivalent code 1992 = 91. *_nlcd1992_***_91: Woody wetlands measured 1992. Equivalent code    2001, 2006 2011 = 90. *_nlcd1992_***_92: Emergent herbaceous wetlands measured 1992.    Equivalent code 2001, 2006, 2011 = 95. *_nlcd**_***_95: Emergent herbaceous wetlands. Note, variable    calculated 1992 (** = 2001, 2006, 2011). Equivalent code    1992 = 92. *_roaddensity_***: Roads within zone, calculated sum    length meters, sum length meters divided area zone    hectares (*** = sum_lengthm, density_mperha) *_slope_***: slope cell slope respect    immediate neighbors (10m scale). Cells zone summarized either    minimum, maximum, mean, standard deviation (*** = min, max,    mean, std) *_tri_***: Terrain ruggedness index (TRI) cell    absolute difference meters elevation focal cell    immediate neighbors (10m scale).    Cells zone summarized either minimum, maximum, mean,    standard deviation (*** = min, max, mean, std) *_zoneid: unique zone identifier (* = iws, hu12, hu8, hu4, edu,    county, state) lagoslakeid: unique integer identifier focal lake lakeconnection: connectivity class focal lake. iws.lulc    table. borderiws: whether iws zone intersects Canadian border    (1 = yes, NA = ). iws.lulc table.
